tweets.text: @DuncanTWilson @hortijames @agricontract @EnvAgency As Ben said in another thread. If you can‚Äôt grow potatoes on a field without it ending up in a river then you shouldn‚Äôt be growing them there at all. Loads of things you can do to mitigate though on high risk fields.

As conditions improve, levels on the #Don remain high but are back within the riverbank. We‚Äôre working with @MyDoncaster and local flood wardens and have pumps at #Fishlake should they be needed. Our teams continue to inspect the river and washlands through the night. https://t.co/JJvuKkHr2n

tweets.text: River levels are dropping across the #NorthEast and our incident room is now closed. Flood alerts still in place for the Rivers #Tees and #Skerne. Flood gates at #Yarm and #Croft are expected to open tomorrow morning. Stay #FloodAware. https://t.co/hqRFdReP9o
However, given the flooding history in this area, as a precautionary measure, @EnvAgency & partners in consultation with local Flood Wardens, have decide to deploy their pumping plan.

We understand residents in Fishlake will be extremely anxious but we have been reassured by @EnvAgency that they are continuously monitoring the situation and don‚Äôt expect to issue any Flood Warnings, nor expect any properties to be affected, as river levels are starting to drop.

3 SEVERE Flood Warnings remain on the River Dee this morning. 195 Flood Warnings across the rest of England and Wales @EnvAgency @NatResWales 

The flood risk will continue into the weekend, even though the worst of the rain is over. Latest flood warnings: https://t.co/dMe1MtLefD https://t.co/nAmng9Muqs

tweets.text:
The weather has improved, but river levels are still high and @EnvAgency Flood Alerts remain in place in some parts of the River Don (Kirk Bramwith, Stainforth and Fishlake). 

The River Don continues to over-top near Stainforth spilling into wash lands, as it is designed to do. https://t.co/vvaAdFyb40

Great to meet PM in Didsbury today to show him @EnvAgencyNW flood defences & introduce him to our fantastic field teams üôå  They‚Äôve been working round the clock to ensure we keep people safe. Across GMMC we‚Äôve protected 23,000 homes from  flooding #TeamEA https://t.co/uXrajrhv8O
@AdamBaylissEA @RachelB97062555 @LizBallard_SRWT @EnvAgencyYNE @RMBCPress @MyDoncaster Why can't it get out please? Does it have one of those hinged doors, or is it something else?

tweets.text: @EdCTBrown @hortijames @agricontract @EnvAgency It a fare stance. Let's assume that field was recently harvested from potatoes, what would be your suggestion? I'm currently thinking of leaving all trams unplanted and growing cover crop strips but then I'll need to pull the tattie rotation tighter to make up for loss of area?

New videoüëáshows Mersey flood gates all but closed. Sale Water Park a good 2-3 m higher as result (see next tweet). The flood gates & Sale WP (hole left by m60 works) did their job for folk! No houses flooded!üôèflood planners! @EnvAgencyNW #flooding #StormChristoph #Chorlton https://t.co/fqFGw8EIjp

Wow.... water storage at #Bickershaw during Storm Christoph 3ha of floods a metre deep on the flood plain @EnvAgency @WiganCouncil @Lancswildlife This is slow the flow at the landscape scale....... https://t.co/1rvzNsFt07

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
.@EmmaHowardBoyd accompanied the Prime Minister on a visit to #Didsbury today following #StormChristoph, to see how #TeamEA is working with emergency services and local government to protect against flooding.

Read her blog on the operational response: https://t.co/IojoGlCzXo https://t.co/WJhY9kXgfH

We've been at @HardcastleNT today to have a nosy around after the turbulent few days we've been having weather wise. Check out the tethered leaky dams doing their job of keeping Hebden Bridge dry. We are incredibly pleased to see our work doing a grand job.
#slowtheflow https://t.co/WGLm6eQX6F

tweets.text: @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @BorisJohnson My home is at severe and imminent risk of financial collapse due to not being able to earn my living because of your lockdown restrictions. What is your plan? Or should I just give up now and lie down and die? And could you pay my funeral costs please?

@RachelB97062555 @LizBallard_SRWT @EnvAgencyYNE @RMBCPress @MyDoncaster The short answer is ‚Äòno‚Äô. I was going to try and write that in my first tweet but ran out of characters.

There is a culverted watercourse that normally spills into the Rother. In high flows it‚Äôs not able to get out so the pumps are used to maintain normal base flows üëç
